meta.name: Deceleration Specialization Block - Basketball
meta.owner: Austin Lawrence, Director of Performance Systems
meta.codexReference: Exercise Progression Law v1.0.1, Load Standards v2.1.2, Governance v4.0, MDP_COURT_VERTICAL v1.3

block_definition.description: 4-week intensive deceleration and change-of-direction block emphasizing braking mechanics, eccentric control, and COD efficiency for basketball athletes. Focuses on injury prevention and movement quality under direction change demands.
block_definition.adaptation_target: Eccentric strength, braking force symmetry, COD speed (505 test), knee/ankle stability under direction change, movement efficiency
block_definition.season_rationale: Deceleration work is less CNS-demanding than elastic specialization and can extend into PREP_SEASON. IN_SEASON phases have too much competition-induced braking load to add focused decel training. POST_SEASON requires recovery, not decel emphasis.
block_definition.population_rationale: Youth 8-12 lack eccentric strength capacity and neuromuscular control for intensive deceleration training. This block operates at moderate-high intensity with significant unilateral and eccentric demands.

complementary_block.relationship: Sequential or alternating emphasis within annual plan
complementary_block.recommendation: Run elastic block in early OFF_SEASON (weeks 1-4), transition to baseline (weeks 5-6), then deceleration block (weeks 7-10). OR alternate elastic/decel blocks across training years.
complementary_block.caution: Do NOT run elastic + decel blocks consecutively without 2+ week baseline buffer

entry_requirements.description: Mandatory gates that MUST be passed before athlete can enter block. EPA will validate these before generating week 1.

readiness_gate.rationale: Deceleration work requires full neuromuscular control and tissue health. YELLOW/RED states compromise eccentric capacity and injury risk.

season_gate.rationale: More flexible than elastic block - decel work can extend into prep phase as it supports sport-specific movement preparation

single_leg_squat_quality.assessment_method: FMS-style single-leg squat with scoring rubric (depth, control, alignment, stability)
single_leg_squat_quality.rationale: Unilateral strength and control are prerequisites for safe deceleration training. Score <7/10 indicates insufficient base.

knee_valgus_status.assessment_method: Single-leg squat, single-leg landing, lateral movement screening
knee_valgus_status.rationale: Any knee valgus present = immediate injury risk under deceleration loads. Must be corrected before entering block.

hip_control_bilateral.assessment_method: Bilateral squat, bilateral landing, hip hinge pattern assessment
hip_control_bilateral.rationale: Hip-dominant braking pattern prerequisite for deceleration mechanics

ankle_dorsiflexion.rationale: Adequate ankle mobility required for proper deceleration shin angle and force absorption
ankle_dorsiflexion.enforcement: SOFT_GATE (warn if <35°, allow with mobility supplementation)

bilateral_squat_competency.definition: Athlete can perform bodyweight squat to parallel with control for 10+ reps
bilateral_squat_competency.rationale: Foundational strength capacity required before eccentric emphasis

eccentric_exposure_weeks.definition: Athlete has completed minimum 4 weeks of tempo eccentric work (3/0/1 or slower)
eccentric_exposure_weeks.rationale: Eccentric capacity must be developed before intensive deceleration demands

unilateral_strength_asymmetry.assessment_method: Single-leg hop test distance comparison L vs R
unilateral_strength_asymmetry.rationale: Asymmetries >15% increase injury risk under unilateral deceleration loads
unilateral_strength_asymmetry.enforcement: SOFT_GATE (warn if >15%, require corrective work alongside block)

absolute: Active knee injury (ACL, meniscus, MCL/LCL sprain, patellar tendinopathy acute phase)
Any fracture or stress fracture lower limb within 6 months
contraindications.enforcement: Absolute contraindications = HARD_GATE, Relative = SOFT_GATE with monitoring and potential volume reduction

weekly_structure.description: Progressive 4-week deceleration emphasis cycle with deload week 4

week_1.primary_adaptation: Eccentric control, bilateral deceleration patterns, hip-dominant braking, force absorption

Youth_13_17.note: Lower contact volume than elastic block - decel work is less contact-dense but more eccentric-demanding. Sprint work integrated for decel context.

e_node_distribution.E0: 60-70% (non-plyometric eccentric work, tempo squats, decel drills)

session_totals.note: Week 1 emphasizes E0-E1 work, bilateral patterns, eccentric tempo

week_2.primary_adaptation: Single-leg eccentric strength, unilateral braking patterns, lateral force absorption, asymmetry reduction

Youth_13_17.note: Volume increases slightly as unilateral work added

session_totals.note: Week 2 adds unilateral + lateral emphasis, maintains eccentric focus

week_3.primary_adaptation: Change-of-direction speed, braking-to-acceleration transition, multi-directional control, sport-specific COD patterns

Youth_13_17.note: Peak volume week - COD work is contact-dense but lower impact than reactive plyos

intensity_management.rationale: Week 3 is highest volume and multi-directional complexity. CNS demand moderate-high but lower than elastic block week 3 due to less reactive/shock work.
monitoring_required: COD mechanics assessment (plant foot position, trunk control)
Any hesitation or guarding on cuts

regression_protocol.if_knee_valgus_emerges: IMMEDIATE stop, regress to bilateral week 1 patterns
regression_protocol.if_ankle_instability: Reduce COD angles, increase straight-line decel emphasis
regression_protocol.if_excessive_braking_distance: Reduce speed, focus on mechanics over velocity

session_totals.note: Week 3 peak volume + multi-directional complexity - requires excellent movement quality

week_4.primary_adaptation: Tissue restoration, movement quality refinement, performance assessment under reduced fatigue
week_4.purpose: Reduce training stress by 40-50% while maintaining movement quality. Assess COD improvements and deceleration mechanics. Prepare for transition out of block.

exercise_selection_rules.intensity_management: Low-moderate intensity, perfect technique emphasis, assessment-driven
exercise_selection_rules.assessment_integration: Week 4 includes formal COD testing and movement quality re-screening

assessments.method: 15m sprint, 180-degree turn, 5m return, measure best of 3 trials each direction
assessments.success_criterion: ≥3% improvement from block entry OR <10% asymmetry L vs R

assessments.method: Force plate bilateral landing, compare L vs R peak force
assessments.alternative: Single-leg hop distance test if no force plates

assessments.method: Visual assessment on landings, cuts, single-leg work

exercises.note: Reduced tempo from week 1, maintain quality

session_totals.note: 50% volume reduction from week 3, assessment integrated

exit_criteria.description: Mandatory performance and health checks before transitioning out of block
exit_criteria.enforcement: EPA will not generate post-block programming until exit criteria validated

cod_speed_improvement.rationale: Primary adaptation target - COD efficiency must improve

deceleration_force_symmetry.test: Bilateral landing force plate analysis OR single-leg hop distance test
deceleration_force_symmetry.rationale: Asymmetries indicate incomplete deceleration capacity development or injury risk

braking_mechanics_quality.test: Coach visual assessment of jump stop and COD patterns
braking_mechanics_quality.rationale: Quality must be maintained under speed - not just speed improvement

single_leg_squat_maintained.pass_threshold: Score ≥7/10 AND no worse than block entry
single_leg_squat_maintained.rationale: Unilateral control must be maintained despite training stress

knee_valgus_absent.test: Visual screening on landings, cuts, single-leg work
knee_valgus_absent.pass_threshold: Zero valgus present on all movement screens
knee_valgus_absent.rationale: Any valgus emergence = block failed, tissue not ready for intensity

no_knee_pain.pass_threshold: No knee pain during or after deceleration/COD work

no_ankle_instability.pass_threshold: No ankle pain, swelling, or instability on COD patterns

no_hip_flexor_strain.pass_threshold: No hip flexor pain during deceleration or sprint work

minimum_green_weeks.definition: Athlete maintained GREEN readiness for at least 3 of 4 weeks
minimum_green_weeks.rationale: If frequent YELLOW/RED, decel volume exceeded capacity

SUCCESSFUL_COMPLETION.criteria: All performance + movement quality + tissue health criteria passed
SUCCESSFUL_COMPLETION.action: Approve transition to next block or return to baseline
SUCCESSFUL_COMPLETION.next_block_recommendation: Return to MDP_COURT_VERTICAL baseline programming OR Elastic Specialization Block (if not already completed) OR Velocity/Acceleration Block

PARTIAL_SUCCESS.criteria: COD speed improved BUT movement quality concerns OR tissue issue
PARTIAL_SUCCESS.action: Require 1-week corrective protocol before next block
PARTIAL_SUCCESS.corrective_focus: Address limiting factor (knee control, ankle stability, asymmetry correction)

FAILED_BLOCK.criteria: No COD improvement OR movement quality degraded OR tissue health issue
FAILED_BLOCK.action: TERMINATE specialization approach, return to bilateral foundational work
FAILED_BLOCK.investigation_required: Identify failure cause (insufficient prerequisites, volume too high, technique breakdown)

transition_protocol.description: How to safely exit block and return to baseline programming

activity_during_recovery: NO plyometric work (if planning elastic block next)
post_block_recovery.rationale: Decel work is less CNS-demanding than elastic work, so shorter recovery window acceptable

next_block_timing.rationale: Decel block can transition to elastic block sooner than vice versa (less recovery needed). But still need 2-week buffer to rebalance training emphasis.
next_block_timing.sequencing_recommendation: If running both blocks in single training year: Elastic (weeks 1-4) → Baseline (weeks 5-6) → Decel (weeks 7-10) → Baseline remainder of off-season

monitoring_requirements.description: What must be tracked throughout block to ensure safety

readiness_assessment.action_if_yellow: Reduce volume by 20%, reduce COD angles to 45° only
readiness_assessment.action_if_red: Skip COD work, convert to bilateral eccentric emphasis (week 1 style) or Zone 8

single_leg_squat_spot_check.action_if_degraded: Reduce unilateral work, increase bilateral emphasis for session

knee_alignment.monitor: Visual screening on every landing and cut
knee_alignment.action_if_valgus: IMMEDIATE stop, regress to bilateral work, do not progress until corrected

braking_distance.monitor: Distance required to decelerate from sprint
braking_distance.action_if_lengthened: Reduce sprint speed, focus on hip-back mechanics

hesitation_or_guarding.monitor: Athlete hesitation before cuts or defensive body language
hesitation_or_guarding.action_if_present: Reduce complexity, increase confidence through simpler patterns

knee_pain_query.method: Ask athlete: any knee discomfort during or after session?
knee_pain_query.action_if_yes: Ice, reduce volume next session by 30%, investigate mechanics

ankle_stability_check.method: Single-leg balance test, palpate for tenderness
ankle_stability_check.action_if_unstable: Add ankle stability work, may require brace for COD work

cod_speed_test.action_if_no_improvement: Technique issue - focus on mechanics over speed

asymmetry_tracking.method: Single-leg hop distance L vs R
asymmetry_tracking.action_if_asymmetry_increasing: Add corrective unilateral work for weaker side

coach_guidance.description: Coaching notes for implementing this block
when_to_use_this_block: COD speed or deceleration mechanics identified as limiter
Knee injury risk reduction priority (valgus present, previous ACL)
OFF_SEASON or PREP_SEASON with no competitions for 5 weeks
Athlete has completed eccentric strength foundation (4+ weeks tempo work)
when_NOT_to_use_this_block: Any in-season phase (use maintenance COD work instead)
Significant strength asymmetries (>15% L vs R)
Athlete has <4 weeks eccentric training exposure
common_mistakes_to_avoid: Progressing to reactive/unplanned COD before planned COD mastered
Adding volume beyond population ceilings (Youth 13-17: 120/session, Adult: 140/session)
Running decel + elastic blocks consecutively without buffer
Treating as 'conditioning' rather than 'movement quality' work
success_indicators: Athlete reports feeling more confident on cuts
Visual COD mechanics cleaner (hip back, trunk control, foot position)

relationship_to_elastic_block.complementary_not_redundant: Elastic block = vertical/reactive power. Decel block = braking/COD efficiency. Different adaptations.
relationship_to_elastic_block.recommended_sequencing: Elastic → Baseline → Decel OR Decel → Baseline → Elastic within single training year
relationship_to_elastic_block.do_not_stack: Never run elastic + decel back-to-back. Minimum 2-week baseline buffer required.
relationship_to_elastic_block.population_considerations: Youth 13-17 may only run ONE specialization block per training year. Adults can run both if separated properly.

epa_integration_specifications.description: How EPA must use this block during session generation

pre_generation_validation.step_1: Validate all entry_requirements before generating week 1
pre_generation_validation.step_5: Load athlete's single-leg squat score and asymmetry data
pre_generation_validation.step_6: IF any entry requirement fails → REJECT block, provide reason code + legal alternative

weekly_generation_logic.week_1: Use week_1.exercise_selection_rules, emphasize bilateral + eccentric, validate E0-E1 dominance
weekly_generation_logic.week_2: Use week_2.exercise_selection_rules, add unilateral + lateral patterns, validate stance distribution shift
weekly_generation_logic.week_3: Use week_3.exercise_selection_rules, integrate COD patterns, validate direction_complexity increase
weekly_generation_logic.week_4: Use week_4.exercise_selection_rules, reduce volume 40-50%, integrate assessments

exercise_filtering_per_week.method: Apply e_node_distribution + stance_distribution as filters on AETHER library
exercise_filtering_per_week.example_week_2: If session needs 80 contacts with stance_distribution Unilateral=15-25%, select unilateral exercises totaling 12-20 contacts
exercise_filtering_per_week.enforcement: Weekly distributions are SOFT targets, population ceilings and tier caps are HARD enforcement
exercise_filtering_per_week.exercise_id_requirement: CRITICAL: All selected exercises MUST include valid exercise_id from AETHER library

session_validation_gates.gate_4: All exercises pass Exercise Progression Law validation
session_validation_gates.output_if_fail: REJECTED with reason_code, legal alternative provided

post_block_validation.requirement: EPA must validate exit_criteria before generating post-block programming
post_block_validation.if_exit_criteria_passed: Generate transition_protocol week 1 programming (60% volume, E0-E1 emphasis)
post_block_validation.if_exit_criteria_failed: ESCALATE to coach for manual review and corrective programming

integration_with_exercise_progression_la.description: How this block applies Exercise Progression Law v1.0.1

week_2_progression.axes_unchanged: load_band, e_node_distribution (slight shift but within tier), reactivity
week_2_progression.compliance: TWO axes progressed - justified as block-level emphasis shift after week 1 consolidation

week_4_regression.purpose: Deload week intentionally regresses for recovery

Youth_13_17.direction_max: Multi_Directional_Combined (planned COD only per Exercise Progression Law)

Adult.direction_max: Multi_Directional_Combined (reactive COD allowed per Exercise Progression Law)
Adult.load_band_max: Band_4 (though rarely used in decel block)

v1.0.0.changes: Initial production release - built from elastic block proven architecture
